results.title: Learning about life
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
Dealing with changes in the physical, social, cultural, political and economic spheres of Australian life. Each program is made up of short sequences from films and videos stored in the archives of Film Australia. In this, the second of three programs dealing with Australia’s social environment, the underlying theme relates to socialisation, rites of passage, celebrations, the family, childhood training, formal education, peer group influences, informal education and learning throughout life. Presented by Annette Shun Wah.

results.title: Learning about leaves
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William M. Harlow
results.brief_description: How leaves are important to plants, animals and humans. Different kids of leaves; how leaves are related to other parts of the plant; the functions of green leaves; the changes that take place through the seasons. Uses time-lapse photography, animation and close-ups.

results.title: Learning about learning
results.creator_credit: Mitchell Grayson, American Psychological Association and National Educational Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on behaviour: the science of psychology”.
Explores the different strategies employed in developing new theoretical concepts about the human ability to learn. These studies, conducted with human beings and animals, have led to changes in methods of instruction.

results.title: Learning about flowers and their seeds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and animation to illustrate the biological functions of flowers and their seeds, the reproduction cycle, from seed to plant, to flower and back to seed. Demonstrates their contribution to the food supply.

results.title: Learning about flowers
results.brief_description: An instructional film for primary classes explaining that the main function of flowers is to produce seeds. Identifies some common varieties of flowers including the morning glory, goatsbeard tulip, pussy willow and dogwood. Observes by use of close up time-lapse photography the stages in the growth of a bud, and in the growth of fruits from flowers.

results.title: Learning about electric current. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film is an introduction to the principles of electricity. Laboratory experiments and animated drawings illustrate the chemical, magnetic and heat effects of electric current. Scenes include such things as copperplating, and the flow of electrons within the filament of an incandescent bulb.

results.title: Learning about air
results.creator_credit: ACI Films, Stelios Roccos and Peter Scheer
results.brief_description: Introduces basic scientific properties of air using simple examples. Shows that air has weight, occupies space and can exert pressure; explains that a combination of a force with air can create energy as in the powering of a windmill. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACI Films, Stelios Roccos and Peter Scheer

results.title: Learning & achievement
results.creator_credit: Darrel Schwandt, George A. Colburn, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
The role that learning plays in the lives of children, the functions of schooling and children’s orientation toward mastery and achievement are addressed as events surrounding the child’s first day of school in Japan, Russia, Brazil and the U.S. are observed. Discusses variables that enhance learning and promote competence.
